scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The 1970s Series comprises two files, Miscellaneous Letters and Subject File. Arrangement of the Miscellaneous Letters is chronological while the Subject File is arranged alphabetically. This Series includes materials from the early years of the decade, 1970-1973. Other materials from the later 1970s are represented in the Addendum 1974-1985.

Chandler, though in his seventies, continued his active participation in state affairs during the 1970s. He completed a four-year term on the University of Kentucky's Board of Trustees in 1970. In 1971 he ran unsuccessfully as an independent candidate for Governor of Kentucky against Republican Tom Emberton and Democrat Wendell Ford. Chandler's practice as an attorney and ownership of the Woodford County, Kentucky, Sun Newspaper continued. In 1977, Chandler was appointed to an unprecedented fourth term on the University of Kentucky's Board of Trustees.
